summary: This document consists of daily lieutenant's logs from the Metropolitan Correctional Center in New York for August 13-14, 2019. It records routine operational activities, inmate counts, transfers, and disciplinary actions. The logs show the facility's operations in the days surrounding Jeffrey Epstein's death, though he is not explicitly mentioned in these entries.

events.title: Inmates Placed in SHU
events.description: Inmates Outlaw, Gonzalez, and Ramos were placed in the Special Housing Unit (SHU) for disciplinary reasons including introduction of contraband, destroying property, and possession of a cellphone.

events.title: Fight in 5 North Unit
events.description: A body alarm was activated in the 5 North unit due to a fight, resulting in three inmates being placed in the Special Housing Unit (SHU).

events.title: Inmates Placed in Administrative Detention
events.description: Inmates Nicholas, Brown, and Acosta were placed in Administrative Detention pending SIS (Special Investigative Services) investigation following the fight.

locations.name: Metropolitan Correctional Center, New York, NY
locations.context: The federal detention facility where the daily logs were recorded.

keyFacts: The logs cover August 13-14, 2019, which are dates immediately surrounding Jeffrey Epstein's death on August 10, 2019, though he is not mentioned in these specific entries.
Multiple inmates were on psychological observation with inmate companions, indicating mental health monitoring protocols within the facility.
A fight occurred on August 14, 2019, in the 5 North unit, leading to three inmates being placed in SHU and three others placed in Administrative Detention pending investigation.
The facility experienced operational issues including an inoperable fire alarm and pump system and a malfunctioning public address system preventing PREA announcements.
The logs show routine inmate movements including court appearances, new commitments, releases on bail, and transfers to/from USMS custody.
